channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Maximo Asset Management
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Maximo Asset Management

item.title: CVE-2019-4478|2024-09-17T02:21:03.520Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0, and 7.6.1 could allow an authenticated user to obtain highly sensitive information that they should not normally have access to. IBM X-Force ID: 163998.

item.title: CVE-2018-2028|2024-09-17T02:32:33.413Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 could allow a an authenticated user to replace a target page with a phishing site which could allow the attacker to obtain highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 155554.

item.title: CVE-2019-4486|2024-09-17T02:27:26.425Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 164070.

item.title: CVE-2019-4512|2024-09-17T02:36:34.215Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.1 generates an error message that includes sensitive information that could be used in further attacks against the system. IBM X-Force ID: 164554.

item.title: CVE-2019-4530|2024-09-17T04:09:08.763Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6, 7.6.1, and 7.6.1.1 could allow an authenticated user to delete a record that they should not normally be able to. IBM X-Force ID: 165586.

item.title: CVE-2019-4650|2024-09-17T04:14:29.055Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.1 is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database. IBM X-Force ID: 170961.

item.title: CVE-2022-40616|2024-09-17T03:08:22.778Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.1, 7.6.1.2, and 7.6.1.3 could allow a user to bypass authentication and obtain sensitive information or perform tasks they should not have access to. IBM X-Force ID: 236311.

item.title: CVE-2019-4591|2024-09-17T01:26:40.836Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 does not invalidate session after logout which could allow a local user to impersonate another user on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 167451.

item.title: CVE-2022-22436|2024-09-17T03:18:23.384Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 224164.

item.title: CVE-2019-4429|2024-09-17T02:36:20.669Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 162886.

item.title: CVE-2021-29743|2024-09-17T03:08:27.336Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 201693.

item.title: CVE-2019-4430|2024-09-17T03:02:02.249Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 162887.

item.title: CVE-2020-4223|2024-09-17T03:43:41.360Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0.10 and 7.6.1.1 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 175121.

item.title: CVE-2019-4749|2024-09-17T03:22:52.642Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 173308.

item.title: CVE-2020-4529|2024-09-17T04:14:33.871Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 is vulnerable to server side request forgery (SSRF). This may allow an authenticated attacker to send unauthorized requests from the system, potentially leading to network enumeration or facilitating other attacks. IBM X-Force ID: 182713.

item.title: CVE-2017-1499|2024-09-17T00:16:20.442Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.5 and 7.6 could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. IBM X-Force ID: 129106.

item.title: CVE-2019-4671|2024-09-17T02:10:46.368Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database. IBM X-Force ID: 171437.

item.title: CVE-2019-4745|2024-09-17T02:37:26.364Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.0 could allow a remote attacker to disclose sensitive information to an authenticated user due to disclosing path information in the URL. IBM X-Force ID: 172883.

item.title: CVE-2021-38935|2024-09-17T00:11:40.167Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.2 does not require that users should have strong passwords by default, which makes it easier for attackers to compromise user accounts. IBM X-Force ID: 210892.

item.title: CVE-2021-20509|2024-09-17T03:32:23.470Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 is potentially vulnerable to CSV Injection. A remote attacker could execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper validation of csv file contents. IBM X-Force ID: 198243.

item.title: CVE-2018-1528|2024-09-17T03:17:22.512Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6 through 7.6.3 could allow an authenticated user to obtain sensitive information from the WhoAmI API. IBM X-Force ID: 142290.

item.title: CVE-2018-1414|2024-09-17T03:59:50.300Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.5 and 7.6 is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database. IBM X-Force ID: 138820.

item.title: CVE-2020-4493|2024-09-17T02:10:47.760Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.0 and 7.6.1 could allow an attacker to bypass authentication and issue commands using a specially crafted HTTP command. IBM X-Force ID: 181995.
